Getting to downtown San Diego was a breeze, which involved a 5 minute walk to the tramway station on the otherside of the freeway and a $6.00 day pass allowed you to travel all through the metropolitan area (would recommend the farmers organic market in Little Italy each week....wonderful food). There were sufficient restaurants within a short walk to feed us (although being vegetarian was a bit of a challenge) and the staff at Pam Pams were great. Would be nice if breakfast was included in the room rate, but the free shuttle service more than made up for it. Would be happy to use again when in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, safe, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: foundsomething
Reviews.Content: Offered free shuttle service to the nearby San Diego attractions, free parking and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Bikers Paradise”
Reviews.Author: thetravelerred
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine but we apparently picked a time when there was a biker convention SO there were many smokers, and many many bikes, some of which were noisy (but that is typical for a big bike). There was parting going on but they seem to know to stop at some point. OK place for our purpose!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a great value with friendly service!!”
Reviews.Author: sara0905
Reviews.Content: My family with 2 young kids, 2 and 6, stayed for a week. From the moment we booked, our emails to the hotel with questions were answered promptly (within an hour!). The promised crib was waiting in the room for us. The front desk staff was always courteous to us. Plenty of beach towels at the pool, printer with the computer in the receptioin room so we could print tickets, coupons, etc. Within 5-10 minutes of everything we did, Sea World, Old Town, the Zoo, the beach, downtown. Close to Target and grocery for shopping, since we could keep snacks in the room's fridge and also had a microwave. Not luxurious, but clean, quiet, friendly, centrally located and a great price...everything we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent, Affordable Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: FlyMeToTheMoon
Reviews.Content: I didn't have very high expectations for this hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised. It was clean, comfortable, and spacious enough for my husband, 5 month old and me to have a very enjoyable weekend. It is in a great location - not beachfront, not in an area you can walk out your door to attractions - but not too far from anything either. You need to have a car, but you can also take advantage of the shuttle runs from the hotel to Sea World. The pool was fun for my infant, the restaurant served it's purpose for an early morning snack to tide us over, and the room itself was big enough for us to spread out and have a pack and play for our son. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a decent, no-frills, reasonably priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlfriday989
Reviews.Content: The Days hotel is well located for Sea World, Mission Beach, Coronado, the Old Town and the Gas lamp district, none of which are more than 15 minutes away by car. Fashion Valley shopping mall is about 5 minutes by car. The hotel is easy to find on Hotel Circle off Highway 8. The rooms are large, very clean with good storage, an in room safe and a kitchenette. Staff are very helpful. There is free internet access via a PC in the lobby. A very good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and great location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: rockbaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. First time visit. For the cons: The room had a very prominent mildew/musty odor. Parking was tight. The bed was okay but getting on the worn side. The elevator was a little too creaky for my liking. It was an older room but the hotels in this area are all old. I would request a room NOT near the elevator or the corridor as we heard every little sound. No frills. Pros: Clean room and linens, location can't be beat, microwave, coffee pot, iron, hairdryer and safe in room. Pool stayed open until 11:00 p.m. Offered wake-up call. For the value it can't be beat. I would recommend this to a friend. They let you know up front what services will be additional. The location is perfect if you are a tourist and most people just sleep and shower in the rooms anyway. We got a rate of 63.00 with our AARP card. I see the photos show rooms with a view and next time I will try to get one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Accom a bit tricky to find if not local”
Reviews.Author: drhawk100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nites in August 2009 2 adults and 1 child aged 16 years Pros Free Parking Free Courtesy bus available to Seaworld, Zoo and Airport Onsite Restaurant/laundry Swimming Pool Clean room and courteous staff Free Internet Cons Location is on Hotel Circle which as a tourist can be quite difficult to find and access from unfamiliar freeways

Reviews.Title: “Superb value, great staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JackieMcElveny
Reviews.Content: What seems to come through when I read other reviews is consistent praise for the staff. Let me add my voice to that! These people are phenomenal and go out of their way to ensure a comfortable stay. In my own case, I was displaced from my home by an emergency, exhausted and at the end of my tether. Jeremy in reservations and Joy, the on-site PBX operator, could not have been kinder, going the extra distance to arrange an early check-in so I could get some sleep. Joy even called my room after I checked in to see if I'd gotten settled okay. Now, really, do those kinds of things happen? Not often..... For the money, it could not be a better value. Comfortable beds, clean and pleasant rooms, soft linens, hotel restaurant, free wireless, city bus stop across the street, free shuttle service -- and the STAFF who are truly the icing on the cake. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone, especially budget-minded travelers who don't completely want to sacrifice comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker1975
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here I wasn't sure what to expect. So here's what I can tell you...first off check in was a breeze I was 1.5 hours early..no problem. Staff was very friendly and helpful they'll get tickets and book reservations for area attractions for you. Room was clean, beds were super comfy, Nice granite vanity tops. AC, refrigerator, Microwave, blow dryer, iron all worked well. Computer in lobby was helpful for printing boarding passes and show schedules for Seaworld. We used the hotel shuttle to visit Seaworld and it worked out just fine. It does run on a set schedule so reserve a seat the day prior. We never had any parking issues arriving back at the hotel around 10pm each night. It did appear that the hotel was full each night as the parking lot was full when I awoke each morning. We did most of our swimming at the beaches, which are very easy to get to from here. On one evening we got back around 9pm and went for a swim in the pool and used the hot tub..both get thumbs up. As for noise we didn't experience any though we were on the third floor with no one above us..and regarding highway noise......I never heard any, besides every hotel on hotel circle is along the highway so how can you single this one out. honestly with an AC running I never heard any offensive, annoying noise even with it off I didn't. We did eat breakfast each morning at the hotel restaurant and our plates were clean when we left. Never was around for lunch or dinner so can't say. Bottom line, I was looking for a clean, safe, comfortable place with a pool, close to all the attractions I was interested in seeing at a good price and that was exactly what I got...in fact knowing that many of the hotels in the area have been around awhile I set my expectations accordingly. You won't be WOW'd when you drive up but my expectations were exceeded. I found nothing wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBarbiegirl
Reviews.Content: Nice family, budget-friendly hotel close to the attractions. We did not use the on-site restaurant, but enjoyed the heated pool--it was surrounded by tropical foliage and a hill which made it seem very private. Beds were very comfortable. Loved the palm trees surrounding the property. We had a rental car, but the trolley does stop right in front of the hotel. Close to a top-notch mall and many restaurants. We stayed a week and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “what a great find!”
Reviews.Author: SONNYSMOM
Reviews.Content: I cant believe we found this place! 2 days in san diego was not enough! we flew in from vegas, to san diego and called the hotel for a pick up.. Rudy picked us up from the airport in the shuttle, and he treated us like, he was picking up longtime friends! We had gotten there a little early, so they checked our luggage, and gave us directions to the nearby mall, where we went and found our favorite restaurant, pf changs! woohoo! It was a nice outdoor mall to walk around while waiting for check in time. When we got back to the hotel, Alex noticed it was my birthday a few days before and told me a belated happy birthday! I wish I could remember every person's name at this hotel because everyone we came across was friendly, and helpful. This was def the highlight of our trip. Our room, was in the back, by the pool, which was heated and open til 11 at night! which means you can still do seaworld and have time for swimming with the kids after. There is a shuttle to the Zoo, Sea world, airport and amtrak. there is also I noticed the san diego old town trolley which stops out front, If we would have had more time I would have done that too. The rooms were large, the beds were comfy and queen sized, with free bottles of water, a breakfast bar, popcorn and had a fridge and microwave. I can not believe how we lucked out in this stay! Our last day there we came across some rude travelers. The guy at the front desk handled them smoothly and quite professional while the other traveler's were quite rude and demanding! I was, and with the other three familys waiting for the seaworld shuttle quite appalled at his behavior, but the front desk handled it smoothly., and not once did he raise his voice and he still tried everything in his power to help the family and nothing he tried was good enough! I also needed to go to town to visit a friend and the gentleman up front helped me pick a restaurant, and a ride with a shuttle company (who was very nice btw!) and got me there! This place, was a great great stay and I am wanting to go back already! I

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: slaphappy303
Reviews.Content: Got to hotel early and was unable to check in - had to place luggage in a messy closet ourselves, and was told to come back at 4pm. Day 1 -Got to the room and the doors had so many coats of paint on them that they barely closed. We were next to the elevator that by the way the expiration expired in 5/09. Beds were great. The room to the shower and the toilet was a sliding door that didn't lock. could hear everything in the room on the other side of the mirror. Day 2 ok so now we have bugs half pincher half roach looking things - ugly that is all I know. Called front desk was told that happens in the heat - i asked could they come spray - they said they did but the next day they were back!!! Day 3 - Ok I have has enough requested a new room Alex and the front desk was very very very helpful - he said not to worry he would fix it - we left for the day and when we got back to the hotel he placed us in the Business Room in the back of the hotel and had moved our luggage for us- great room with interior doors - and no Bugs. Day 4 - long day at Sea World and got back to the hotel at around 1am to find ourselves not able to get into our rooms - had to walk all the way abck to the front desk to find a very rude young man - that fixed our keys and not once said he was sorry about that. Pool was nice - need to replace some planters rusty and gross - Would I stay here again no and &@#* no! Oh and by the way the parking is the worst - I would rather pay at another hotel to insure that I had a space when I got back to the hotel at night

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mjoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. Room was clean w/fridge & microwave. Beds were very comfortable & air conditioning worked great. Room a bit run down and deco outdated. took the complimentary shuttle to Sea World and were dropped and picked up on time. Breakfast at Pam Pam Cafe was actually really good. For $128/night during Comic-Con it did the trick for us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Uppsala09
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few hotels in the Hotel Circle. We chose the Days Inn because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. The room was large and clean. Internet is included in the reasonable rate as well as parking. OK Breakfast can be had at the nearby diner. The Fashion Valley Shopping Center is within walking distance and offer everything you could need when it comes to eating and shopping. If you have your own car, it is very easy to get to both the Old Town and Sea World. There is also a shuttle service which supposedly stops by the hotel, but the hotel staff did not have much information about it so we ended up using our car instead.

Reviews.Title: “Would DEFINITELY stay again! Most accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: lilangelb2
Reviews.Content: They were the MOST helpful I have ever experienced. When I arrived 3 hours early, they were able to provide me with a room. When I arrived to my room and realized that it was next to an elevator, and requested a room towards the middle of the building, they took care of it right away. Also, I had reservations to go horseback riding but could not remember what the name of the facility was. So, I called the front desk and they stepped away from the front desk and went over to their "public use" computer within their lobby and started to look up horseback riding for me! They must have been on there for at least 10 minutes asking me questions and trying to locate it. We ended up finding it by the way. I thought it was very nice of them to take the time to do that for me. They made my whole experience of staying at that hotel comfortable and accomodating. Unfortunately, I booked 2 days but needed 3 and was unable to book the third room due to high demand that weekend. However, the person that assisted me with locating the horseback riding facility gave me a number to a local agency there in San Diego that specializes in last minute deals. I called and was able to find another hotel just a few miles down the way for the same price. (The Days Hotel had a bigger cleaner room with a bigger, more comfortable BED!) This was my second time staying there this year, and I wouldn't stay anywhere else while in San Diego. Since their rooms are newly refurbished, they are very nice and clean. Plus their beds are the most comfortable I have slept on. For a 3-star hotel and price, you feel like you are staying at a 5-star......

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you book at discount price”
Reviews.Author: Professorparks
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia and we got a really good price. Pro's: We arrived at 10:30 a.m. and they let us check in right away. However, not everyone was so lucky, we arrived on a Monday and that may have helped, someone checking in on a Friday when we left (at 10 a.m.) we told they did not have any rooms ready for them. The room has been updated, but its not luxury, Enjoyed the frig and microwave in the room, TV had lots of channels to watch, beds soft with four pillows on each, very comfy. Pool and spa, though located way in the back of property, were very nice. Wireless internet was great convenience. Shuttle: A big reason we booked this was for the shuttle, as we didn't want to rent a car. Be aware the shuttle runs to limited places, airport, zoo, Sea World, Marine Base and at set times, so the shuttle is not there for whenever you want to come and go. If the shuttle is not busy, they may take you other places, however, we took the shuttle to Old Town and when we called for a pick up, it was not available for over an hour, so we took a taxi back (cost $12). Also, even if you sign up for a pick up time, the shuttle may be early/late and will not wait for you, they pick up whoever is standing there and leave, so be early to your pick up. Also, airport times are also set, every two hours, so we had to take the shuttle three hours before our flight. (or else take the one hour before our fight, that's taking a chance) Con's: Lot's of noise from nearby freeway and streets, (so bring earplugs or run the a/c or fan all night), little choice in eating without a car, their Pam Pam Cafe is just OK, nothing special, another places you need to walk to, computer in lobby was always being used and the night before/morning we left, the computer was broken so don't rely on this to print boarding passes, spa/pool are small considering size of place, so they were very crowded when we went. I would stay again if I had my own vehicle, its also good if you are not planning on being at the hotel much, its a good deal if you are looking for a place to sleep while you do a lot of fun during the day!

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, decent sized rooms and good pool!”
Reviews.Author: msbout
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was a bit scared at first after so many mixed reviews from Yelpers and from Tripadvisor. But I was pleasently surprised. Good, quiet property. Clean, felt safe and enjoyed everything. ADVICE: REQUEST a Sunset Wing room. This is a new building and it is enclosed with hallways. The rest of the property is more like a motel with outside hallways. I dont like that. No privacy and a lot of screaming kids running up and down. The window shades must be closed the entire time if you want privacy. The new building was just fine. Clean, had water, granola and popcorn in room (complimentary) with a microwave and fridge. Was great to store cold water in. The room was big. The beds, HUGE. For this price, I would definately stay here again. Enjoyed the pool and hot tub too. Close to the freeways, access to everywhere. Wouldnt really recommend Pam Pam on the property unless you are VERY desperate and dont want to venture out. Basic, greasy.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: newengland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights to visit san diego. The hotel was very busy and car parking was a challenge. The room was large and a bit dated but had everything that you would need. The microwave was an added bonus as there is no breakfast included at this hotel. The location was good for access into San Diego and was close by the shops and restaurants. Check in was quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: colagel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June 09. The staff was incredibly nice upon checking in. I was looking for just a place for us to sleep with a safe location and no bugs - this served our purposes well. The beds were comfortable, the rooms looked like they tried to keep them clean, and there was a microwave and refrigerator in the room, and they have free wireless internet which is a bit slow, but usable. The bathrooms have a sliding door (which was the hardest thing ever to close) and you can tell the walls have had many coats of paint. The only times we ever heard our neighbors was when they were running the shower or shutting their door. The location is perfect. It's close to the Zoo, Sea World, and the beaches. Although we didn't use it, the hotel has a shuttle to sea world. We did however visit the zoo and loved it. Take Note: Get a parking pass. I noticed the 2nd day we were there cars in the parking lot had parking passes in their windows. Not sure how the staff, although nice, could have missed telling me that when I checked in since my car was parked 10 feet from me while doing so. Luckily, since we checked in so late I think we missed the guard walking around checking the cars - I noticed him the second night. The parking does get busy at night, but we were able to find a space at midnight (weeknight).

Reviews.Title: “Good location - okay room”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoDebbie
Reviews.Content: It's easy to get around everywhere from here. The room was adequate. My husbands Ipod was stolen from the room. Eat somewhere else. The pool was okay, but the hot tub water was kind of greenish.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay in this dump again! Don't MAKE THE MISTAKE OF BOOKING THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Pug15
Reviews.Content: I had this horible room with horible air conditioning. When I first walked in my room I looked under the bed and there was a rotten piece of pizza under the bed and there was spit chips in the air conditioner. The people are rude . Never book this hotel avoid this dirty hotel its not even hotel its a motel!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for our first time....”
Reviews.Author: njgirl05
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for the first time the weekend of 6/11/09. We had no idea what area we wanted to stay in, and hotel circle seemed to be in a good location from a map we were looking at. PROS: Room was mostly updated and very clean. We stayed in room 250, which was directly over the hotel's Pam Pam Restaurant. Initially we thought this would be a problem-not so. We heard NO noise at all while we slept, but did hear some noise in the evening. Nothing that convinced us we needed to move to a different room, though we did request if that was a possibility. If you want complete silence, this isn't your place. We heard people flushing toilets and running water at times in the evening. Not a big deal for us. The shuttle service was very handy-used it to pick us up at the airport, took us to the zoo, and to Old Town San Diego..Very nice drivers who were very helpful. Shuttles DONT run 24/7-we had to take a cab to the airport because our flight left at 6am, shuttle doesn't run until 6. The tiny lobby had a computer with free access-great for printing our boarding passes. We also thought the discount tickets for the zoo offered at the lobby were a good deal. CONS: This hotel is facing a highway. Expect highway noise. I'm a city girl, so this really didn't bother me, except for the occasional tractor trailer. There is no fitness room..I thought there was..I guess I misread the hotel description-unless I missed it somewhere?! Pool and spa are in the rear of the buildings up a small hill. There was no way I was walking all the way back there. (I'm on vacation..call me lazy). Very little to eat in the area unless you had transportation to go elsewhere. The only perk was rolling out of bed and going directly below us for breakfast. The coffee machine in the room had some decent coffee! the view was of the stairs out my window. Again, not a big deal, but if you want a view, forget it. You wont get it here. The TV..now this was interesting..it had terrible static. I'm not one to watch tv when I'm on vacation, but when I wake up, I do like to watch the weather channel. The static made that a challenge. Not horrible that I couldn't hear, but bad enough that I thought, Hmm, they need to upgrade this set soon. All in all..I'm going to give this hotel a decent rating. If you are looking for a clean, moderately priced hotel..this is a go. I won't return, simply because it wasn't really near the areas that I enjoyed most. Next time I'll probably opt for a room closer to the beaches. Good location for families that want to be close to the zoo and balboa park and need a budget friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location...”
Reviews.Author: cruiselover801
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located on Hotel Circle. Very convenient location just off the freeway. Made getting around easy. The front desk staff was awesome. They were very friendly, professional, and helpful. The room was quiet (no traffic noises) and clean. The beds were very comfortable and the room didn't have that "hotel smell". There is a nice pool located at the rear of the property. Parking was free. There were a couple of restaurants within walking distance. The Pam Pam was right next door and there was a Kelly's Steak House within a block. However, if you enjoy Mexican food, I suggest Casa Guadalajara. It's located a short drive from the hotel in Old Towne. The front desk staff can give you directions as to how to get there. Our family would definately stay here again. Great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so clean”
Reviews.Author: angelac1964
Reviews.Content: This was a great central location. Staff was helpful. Rooms were nice enough. Bathroom was not very clean. Thin walls. People above us were very noisy and you could hear every foot step. Restaurant was very nice. I don't know why it got so many bad reviews. We ate breakfast there three mornings and it was very good. Staff was very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The facility & service were excellent. I would recommend to friends.”
Reviews.Author: SDNama
Reviews.Content: The facility and services were excellent. I was there with my family - children and grandchildren to attend my son's wedding. We had such a wonderful experience and the staff was so patient when we were not out of the room when they wanted to clean it. They were so gracious to come back after we were out. This motel made my stay carefree and I did not have to worry about anything and enjoyed my family. Thank you for such great accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “very well run property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: intomischief
Reviews.Content: There are so many things to see and do in San Diego, and this location is great to get to them all. It took less that 10 min. to get to the zoo, Sea World, Coronado, and Mission Beach. The rooms were perfect for a longer stay also with a micro/refrig. The bathrooms were nicelydone with granite counter tops also. My wife and I noticed the upgraded beds and bedding there too. As frequent travelers, not many limited service hotels have beds this nice. We were fortunate to have access to the covered parking also, which is nice on sunny days and two small kids. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful too. We would certainly stay here again when we come back to Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SoDak30
Reviews.Content: Much more than I expected from a Days Hotel ... comfortable, clean rooms and great service, not to mention very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel. Perfect location. Perfect room. Extremely Clean. Ideal for Families.”
Reviews.Author: aztravelmom2
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and stayed at this property for almost a week. Surely one of the best hotels in the Hotel Circle location. Rooms are very nice, spacious, and up-to-date. I was blown away by how clean the room was. I have two small children and wasn't worried one bit about what they could find on the floor. What a relief for a germ-phobe mom. The service was amazing! Everyone was nice and helpful. Requests were fullfilled quickly. They had cribs, refrigerators and no noise issues at all. Again, all ideal for families. You can't beat the location. You can tell they have a management team that really cares about the property and the guests that stay there. Very refreshing! Easy, easy, easy access to main freeways, but without the freeway noise at all. Easy to hit all the main points of interest San Diego has to offer... beaches, zoo, sea world, downtown. Best part, you can purchase tickets to the main attractions directly from them! No waiting in the lines. We couldn't have been happier with our stay at this gem of a property. Would come back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about!”
Reviews.Author: Rikkesteve
Reviews.Content: I've just read a couple of negative reviews about the hotel. Everyone has different expectations & experiences so it would be wrong to say that other peoples views are misguided! We stayed here in April having booked the hotel thanks to various Trip Advisor reviews. We didn't expect 5 star quality or service, we just wanted somewhere clean & comfortable to stay as a base to explore SD and the area around it. Pleased to say that Days Hotel didn't disappoint. The staff were friendly & courteous. On the day before we left I wanted to check in online for our flight home, unfortunately the free internet access PC in reception was out of order. Steve on reception kindly checked my family & I in for our flight & printed out our boarding passes. He wasn't busy at the tme but then again he didn't have to help me. If only that kind of service was available everywhere else! We would have preferred to have stayed closer to the city centre but as we hadn't been to SD before we only had ourselves to blame for not making further enquiries. Overall this was a decent hotel and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service experience ever...look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Rebaphoenix
Reviews.Content: Booked a room through Getaway today and not through hotel directly. First day was ok but the room had a horrible smell in it. Also, the air conditioner did not work properly. they sent up a maintenance person to look at it and he took off the cover and I saw they had the controls locked so that guests couldn't turn down the air as low as possible. He took off the switch blocking the warmer temperatures and the room cooled right down. The shuttle did come in handy as we were spending two days at Sea World-didn't have to pay to park which was nice. Day two we received a phone call to our room pretty close to 1 am (yes 1 am). I answered the phone and it was the night manager telling me to move my car immediately or he would have it towed. Startled out of a dead sleep, I couldn't understand why he wanted my car moved. I woke my husband up and told him it was the manager and we had to move our car. By this time, our daughter was awake too. He didn't like how the car was parked and wanted me to move to a different spot! After a lot of discussion (yes, we were angry) the manager told me he could have us arrested since San Diego has a parking lot patrol and they could give me a ticket for the way I had parked my car (MIND YOU THE CAR HAD BEEN THERE FOR TWO DAYS). I said a ticket for what? It's not in a handicapped space, it's in a normal parking space, OUTLINED AND MARKED IN WHITE PAINT BY THE HOTEL. I stated that I didn't believe him-- that San Diego had a hotel parking lot patrol. And, he said it was true and he was doing me a huge favor and I should thank him. By this time it's well after 1 am. The manager was extremely angry with me questioning his motives--AND we then realized what his motives were. While we were locking up our car, we saw two guests that had just checked in pull into the parking space we were asked to move our car from (I can only guess that these individuals were his friends or something. The night manager wanted my car moved so these "new guests" could have the spot I was parked in. The whole episode was absolutely ridiculous. In the morning I contacted Getaway today and got a refund for the balance of our stay and we left asap. Found a room up the street for less money and were treated with respect and like a valued customer. The employees working at the hotel were nice. The management definitely needs basic customer service training. So let's start with this lesson first: don't call your guests at 1 am unless the hotel is on fire.

Reviews.Title: “Thank god for the shuttle!!”
Reviews.Author: davsyd
Reviews.Content: The hotel shuttle is definatly the best thing about this hotel. After reading the reviews I thought this hotel was going to be quite good, and was expecting the staff to be super friendly as it has been said before. After travelling by car from Las Vegas we were eager to just get to our room. Upon arrival receptionist Bianca was a little cold, no smile, no welcoming just doing her job. We had requested 2 beds, we get to our room and we have a king bed!! Go back down to reception which is a hike as we were on level 3 and very far back from the front of the hotel. Bianca issues new keys and tells me it says on her computer King Bed. I had paper work with me and it clearly says 2 beds. Ok go back up to new room and the keys don't work!! Totally annoying!! Go all the way back down and she wrote the wrong room number down, and said a very reluctant ' sorry'. Finally got to our room. The room has a very musty smell, I think the hotel knows this, as on Level 3 the next day all available rooms had their doors open to air them. Rooms are ok but the smell ruins it. Part of our package was free continental breakfast. I'm thinking cereal, juice, toast, fruit um no.... you get a juice and a choice of toast, muffin or bagel, just 1!!! Another issue we had, was when we were out in downtown we lost our hotel room key with our room number on it! I know silly!! But anyway we rung the hotel and told them to cancel the key just in case someone has found it and gone to our room. But no!! the hotel could not cancel our key because we have to be there in person to recieve the new key?? huh??? It was their 'policy'...after much discussion and getting quite firm with them, they finally cancelled our key. Apart from these issues the hotel shuttle saved this hotel from getting a 1 star!! The shuttle was very helpful and accommadating. I think they should print a timetable so it is clearer on when the shuttle leaves and picks-up. I did hear one family say it did not pick them up from the zoo when it was meant too and they had to get a cab. Overall not the best hotel, front desk staff need to be a bit more friendly, especially when there is so much competition around them.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and will definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: NashaErina
Reviews.Content: Hi This is a really nice hotel in a great location. The front desk staff was polite and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised once we checked into our room, we were again greeted on the telephone - welcoming our stay. The room had a microwave and the free wireless internet was a bonus. We had a lot of activities during the day, so we prefered take-out and have it in the room. Being able to preheat my daughter's food was a plus :). I also had a few things ordered online and have it delivered to the hotel. I was very worried at first. But once I've checked it, the reception handed me the delivered package, I was very relieved and happy. Thanks for being trustworthy. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay (especially Sea World) and look forward to the next visit. P/s : You need to reserve seats (Hotel Shuttle) to take you to Sea World !!

Reviews.Title: “Spring getaway”
Reviews.Author: stevenh1960
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay for the price. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Service is abundant and very friendly. Great place for kids. Pool is nice but you may need to make sure towels are available. Continental breakfast is somewhat modified. Great central location to see all that San Diego has to offer. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel shuttle to and from airport, seaworld and more was the best!”
Reviews.Author: sunfinderWashington
Reviews.Content: After a long winter and many chemo treatments my daughter and I were ready for some R&R. Days Hotel was wonderful with friendly services helping us with our daily activities! Bill our shuttle man was the BEST. He helped us to and from the airport, Sea World, got our reservations for Old Town Trolly, and Seaport Village. He was friendly, on time, and full of helpful tourist imformation. The rooms were cleaned every day and we even took time to enjoyed the pool. Thanks for sunshine! It's was the doctor ordered.

Reviews.Title: “everything you will need for a great holiday in San Diego with young children”
Reviews.Author: paddlingbear
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Days Hotel, San Diego as part of a vacation package booked with Alaska Airlines. I felt compelled to write a review as we were pleasantly surprised in many areas of this hotel. Our family was travelling on a budget and the free shuttle service to the airport and the San Diego Zoo was convenient and amazing! The location of the hotel was perfect for us as it was in a nice area of town central to exactly what we needed. There is a beautiful shopping mall only a ten minute walk away as well as a local transit station that will hook you up with all transit services that basically will take you anywhere you want to go in San Diego. The rooms were especially clean and comfortable. The staff (including maid service, front desk, shuttle drivers) were extremely friendly and professional. The outdoor areas (including the pool) are nicely landscaped and spotless. There is a small restaurant attached to this hotel that we had most of our meals at. The food was not only excellent but reasonably priced. Overall if we are ever in the San Diego area again, I will choose this hotel for my family! Thank you!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: sharpette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights and was not disappointed. Hotel has own airport pickup bus and they will also take you to major attractions. The hotel looks like nothing special but has agood pool , rooms are clean and a good size. 10 minute walk to trolley which will take you to downtown, the gaslamp quarter and old town. Fashion valley mall about 10 mins away also...go to the cheesecake factory..best lunch and dessert we have ever tasted ! Also Cafe Coyote in Old Town has killer mexican food. Gargae down the road has small convienence store attached and next to this is the family restaurant which has good affordable and filling meals. Would recommned this hotel to people staying in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for clean, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Tommydog127
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights, February 24 through March 2nd, 2009. Attended son's graduation from Marine boot camp and spent some days doing tourist type things. Great location- less than 10 minutes from the Marine Depot and all other locations in the San Diego area were a breeze to get to from the hotel. When I booked the hotel, I had some doubts it would be ok because the price was so reasonable. I was very pleasantly surprised once we got there- the room was very clean and comfortable and the hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. We stayed in a room at the far end of the hotel- away from the highway and it was very quiet. The hotel has this funky little restaurant called the Pam Pam Grille- it seems like a hole in the wall kind of a place but my wife and I thought the food was outstanding- on various days we had either breakfast, lunch or dinner there. If you are into keeping your exercise regime going while staying at the hotel, there is a fitness club located about a five minute walk from the hotel- Frog's Fitness. Frog's is a very nice club to work out at and it is so close to the hotel. Less than a 10 minute drive is a Ralph's supermarket so you can pick up a few things there and keep stuff in the refrigerator in the room. We highly recommend this hotel as a great value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Some good - some not so good”
Reviews.Author: jeffm4000
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice property with a great location, friendly staff and the rate I got was great. I did have some problems upon arrival and during stay, and most were addressed, some were not. Very upset that I make a reservation months on advance for a king room and when I check in there is no king available. What is the purpose of making advance reservation? When we checked in at 9PM on THursday evening, there were 6 guests lined up waiting to check in, with only one front desk clerk helping us, yet we could hear two other employees in the back having a wonderful conversation about anything other than work. Upon check in lamp and telephone did not work - maintenance fixed promptly. First night toilet "ran" all night and even flushed itself often. I finally had to turn off the valve under the toilet. Maintenance fixed following day. Being placed on the 2nd floor and having the elevator out of service 2 days was awful. My wife has rheumatoid arthritis.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, good location, staff could be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: jessc2078
Reviews.Content: The overall stay at the Days Hotel was fair. The rooms were clean and the hotel was conveniently located. The only complaint we had was that the staff could have been more accommodating when we complained about children in rooms on either side of us running down the hall at early hours of the morning making noise the entire weekend. We called the front desk to complain, they said they would send a housekeeper to check on the problem but it continued throughout our stay. In the future, the staff at the Days Hotel should take ALL their guests into consideration and try to make their stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back what a nice hotel for the price. Stayed 3 nights paid 65 a night. Nice cafe located in the hotel. Rooms were very nice and well kept up. close to main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Newtraveler83
Reviews.Content: The Days Hotel was good overall. The price was terrific, only about $66 per night. I did book online for a business place room in the newer building of the hotel, but was given a room in the older section. I didn't realize it until I was already in the room and since the room was pretty nice, and since the lady at the front desk was kind of grouchy, I didn't mention it. I didn't have time upon checkout to mention it either. The room was clean and comfortable. I didn't have a chance to go swimming, but when I went to check out the pool, it looked pretty nice. The shuttle service wasn't nearly as convienient as I thought it would, but the shuttle driver that picked us up from the airport was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & convenient. An excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Roads
Reviews.Content: It's funny, but to me it appears most of the poor reviews for this location cite downright petty gripes... sort of like they were blatant vendetta-reviews because a 2-star accommodation didn't kiss some 4-star posterior. Those folks should have opted for the $400-per-night accommodations on Harbor Island. For the rest of us San Diego visitors who expect a clean, comfortable room for a reasonable price, Days Hotel Circle is an excellent choice. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: albocoupster
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights and got 4th free $66 per night. good location the 120 bus stop outside hotel 10 minutes to Gaslight area. The room was very clean and we ended up staying 6 nights. Would certainly recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ktprincess1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, rooms kinda musty smelling but very comfy and clean. Employees were very nice and helpful. The pampam cafe has good food but horriable service. This is not the most central place to be but they have shuttles to alot of places.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AZfamily15
Reviews.Content: I have average expectations when staying at a motel or hotel being in the restaurant industry. My main expectation is that the room be clean and in good repair. I was very pleased with this place, room was clean and in good reapir. Room size was great. We had plenty of room to get ready and for all the stuff we brought with us, which for a three day trip was alot. I ate at the restaurant my wife loved her meal the Bacon Cheesbuger but the talapia was not the best. It is more of a diner than a restaurant so don't have high expectations but it is nice having one on site. There are serveral restaurants in the area, none are chains. Front desk staff are average some good, some bad. Drivers for shuttle were excellent...free shuttle to Seaworld thats a $12 savings on parking. I tipped the driver. But no fast food in the immediate area, but its only 5 or 10 min away. Same with all the other chain restaurants. General Location is great and easy to find, right of I-8.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: dianemdus
Reviews.Content: The Cafe closed at 9:00, which was very inconvenient. So we had to walk down the street to a restaurant connected to another hotel. When we inquired about shuttle to MCRD, we were told, because we booked through Hotels.com we had to wait to make sure everyone else got on the shuttle first. The shuttle driver was very rude that picked us up on Graduation Day at MCRD. He told us we all could get off. What do we expect out of him when he makes minimum wage and after all it is a FREE shuttle. He told the newly graduated Marines, he'd go get the General and they could go back to boot camp and learn something. The Marines didn't do a thing. We all put our names on a list and he didn't even go by that. He was just RUDE. The other shuttle driver we had that picked us up from the airport and picked us up from MCRD the day before was so nice. I didn't think the rooms were as nice as the website stated. I was told we could get discounted tickets at the front desk for Sea World. We get there and they are full price. I was told late check out wouldn't be a problem and yet they put us through a waiting period, which we didn't need being graduation day for our Marine. So all in all I believe they didn't make my visit very comfortable. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “didn't even meet low expectations”
Reviews.Author: lattegirl
Reviews.Content: I had extremely low expectations and the motel (not hotel) was awful. I expected our car to be broken in, or for us to be attacked by bed bugs. I booked the room through Alaska Air Vacations and was limited in the less than $300 a night range. I will let Alaska Air Vacations know about the property. I have similar complaints of other reviews - horrible beds, small gross bathroom, dampness in room, front door stuck and was hard to close, etc. I find interested that the manager constantly replies to reviews. He/she always says that the room in question will be personally inspected. Shouldn't that be done so to avoid bad reviews? I use TripAdvisor for several different hotels and I have rarely seen a hotel manager respond. If this manager cares about the property, fix things so people don't have to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Practical for the price-ok stay”
Reviews.Author: azdisneyfan
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed Sept. 3, 2008 for one night. For the price and location it was not bad. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and staff was helpful and nice. No continental breakfast which would be nice for families instead of having to drive elsewhere. There is a small fridge and microwave. The bathroom is small though with a small vanity area outside of the bathroom. I would recommend this for a couple of nights but any longer I would stay at a hotel instead of a motel especially if you have a family. The room and bathroom is just a bit outdated. Again, It just depends on preference. With a family, we like a big bathroom to bathe our little one and have room in there to get ready comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeweljett
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. The staff was very attentive to our needs, the room was nice and very clean and we loved the pool area (nice private large area with complimentary sun block). We also especially liked the restaurant... the food was excellent for breakfast! And the hotel lobby restroom is beautiful. Although we didn't use it, there is a free shuttle to Seaworld which would save on the parking fee of $12. We're quite particular about cleanliness of hotels and this one was great!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: erebus_111
Reviews.Content: This was a depressing hotel. The room was barely adequate, I wondered if I was going to come down with something just staying there one night. I was booked for three nights, made it through the first night, decided life was too short to be miserable. Parking is odd, the people staying there were out of a Fellini film, the staff was not helpful, the room was dark and dank. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “A little sketchy”
Reviews.Author: beach4me42
Reviews.Content: Our family of five took a 15 day driving holiday from Canada to all the sights and parks in California with a two night stay at the Days Hotel in San Diego. Of the many places we stayed this was our least favorite. I suspect that this hotel has a new area and an old area. Our room was definately in the old part. The room itself was not very clean. The bathroom was old and small, with a sliding door that didn't close properly. The bathroom was dirty (drips of something down the walls) and not very nice. The handle to flush the toilet was broken and you had to flush carefully or it would come off in your hand. We had the type of room where you feel a little uncomfortable because of the wear and tear and cleanliness. The pool area was nice and the kids enjoyed a swim. I'm assuming that there are much nicer rooms at this hotel and we just didn't get one. On the plus side, the front desk staff were helpful in suggesting places to see and eat at. They were also great for giving us driving directions to areas we wanted to get to. We were only in San Diego for 2 nights and really didn't spend much time in our room which I was thankful for. It just wasn't the type of place where you were comfortable going back to your room to relax. As for the value - most place we stayed on our trip had a continental breakfast included for a similar price that we paid at the Days Hotel, so I didn't find the value to be great either. I would try a different hotel if I returned to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect for Us!”
Reviews.Author: allierskine
Reviews.Content: Okay, we were four 21 year old girls staying alone from July 28th-Aug 3rd. After reading the SCARY reviews on trip advisor, we decided that the best thing to do was go, with the intent of moving hotels if things really were as bad as they say... However, things are not as bad as they say, things are actually quite great at Days Inn Hotel Circle! The prices was great! The location was AWESOME: Literally, a ten min walk to the trolley station and then you can go ANYWHERE in san diego! If you are driving, the hotel entrance is just around the corner from the freeway exit! The pool was very nice and the spa was soooooo relaxing! The hotel provides a shuttel to and from the airport, train station, sea world, and the zoo- at no cost! Our shuttle driver was Richard, and he was nice enough to drop us off at Little Italy one night because we had missed the next trolley pick-up! The walls are thin, and if you are right near the elevator you can hear people walking, suitcases being dragged, and the elevator dinging... but that just means you need to stop sleeping and get up and do something!!! All in all, GREAT experience... we are planning another trip to San Diego in January and have already booked our rooms at the Days Inn on Hotel Circle!

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: VAJane
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with this hotel. Good location, friendly and helpful staff, clean and modern rooms. I had low expectations and was pleasantly surprised. They let us check in early which was a great help. Would definitely consider this hotel if staying in the SD area again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay....met my needs!”
Reviews.Author: Fibbersfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all my needs for a recent visit to Sea World. The room was very clean and I was able to get a parking right in front of the room. The hotel is nothing fancy, but I felt safe. Hotel Circle is indeed a busy area with a lot of businesses and hotels/motels. It's not a scenic area. I felt safe at this hotel and believe it is a good option for families looking for simple/nothing fancy lodgings near Sea World. The front desk staff member on duty when I checked in was very friendly and helpful. I was impressed with his politeness and his help in finding the number to my favorate Pizza place. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: LTMArkansas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in my price range and had positive reviews on Tripadvisor and Travelocity. It was better than expected. Check-in was quick, the room was very clean and maid service was excellent. The hotel was well staffed with constant cleaning and upkeep taking place. The in-room safe was a handy surprise. I didn't see any interesting restaurants on Hotel Circle but the access to I-8, I-5 and CA 163 was so convenient, you could be anywhere in San Diego in a few minutes. The restaurants near Old Town were very good, reasonable, and convenient. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SPDG_MOM
Reviews.Content: The Days Hotel is not a fancy resort, and it is not portrayed to be one, and my family had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We stayed in the new wing near the pool (which is as nice as everyone has claimed). Our room was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the convenience of the microwave and refrigerator in room, as well as the complimentary safe. When we got too cold at the beach, we came back to the hotel to enjoy some time in the nicely heated pool. The pool was clean and the scenery was nice and we enjoyed our time by the pool. Staff was very friendly. Maintenance staff were always rushing to assist us and were very pleasant in talking to. We were quite surprised by the excellent treatment by hotel staff. The location in the hotel circle is perfect - we were able to get quickly to SeaWorld, Mission Beach and Old Town which were our primary destinations during our trip. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!! CAMERAS STOLEN!! CLEANING PERSONNEL MADE UNAUTHORIZED ENTRY INTO ROOM”
Reviews.Author: TravelingtheSkies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling from Oklahoma with two other couples and chose the Days Hotel for our overnight accomodations the night before our cruise departed San Diego. Note that their shuttle from the airport doesn't take you directly to the hotel. You may stop at the San Diego zoo, Sea World, the cruise terminal, etc. to pick up/drop off others before you actually get to the hotel 45 mins to an hour after being picked up at the airport. Upon arrival, my aunt (who arrived earlier that day) warned us that the rooms smelled so terrible that she wasn't sure if she could sleep in it. When we got our room, we had the same problem. The smell was terrible. Very strong musty and stale odors. Little did we know the smell would be the least of our problems. The next morning after breakfast (which by the way is NOT free), my husband noticed our cameras had been stolen from our room!! $2,000 worth of cameras and equipment. Gone. Coincidentally, when he walked up to the room after breakfast, which happened to be at 10:45 a.m. and checkout time is 12:00 noon, cleaning personnel were scattering from our room when they saw him coming. After contacting the San Diego Police department, we were informed that this happens frequently at this hotel!! They must be making more money from their camera resales than their rooms!! You would think some of the "extra" proceeds would be spent to freshen up the rooms! When we approached the girl and the man in the lobby/front desk and informed them of what happened, they were uncooperative, rude, and inconsiderate. Unfortunately we didn't have time to pursue it before our shuttle left to take us to the cruise terminal. Upon our return from the cruise, I insisted that their management tell me why cleaning personnel were in my room at all before checkout time!! Their representative (I have a name if you'd like to contact me) informed me that there was no way and that they do not enter rooms before checkout time. I told him my husband caught them in there! They finally removed the key lock from the door and electronically tracked the entries into our room. SURE ENOUGH!!! It proved what my husband had said that there WERE IN FACT cleaning people in our room when they should not have been in there! We were checking out that morning, therefore they had no business in there before noon. The hotel representative (again, I have his name if you'd like) claims their time log shows the unauthorized entry at 11:56a.m. (which by the way is still before noon), however I have breakfast receipts showing either #1 the time stamp on their door locks has the incorrect time, or #2 The Days representative "conveniently" added an hour to the entry time of the cleaning folks. Either way, my cameras are gone, never to return. My 4-year old daughter's first dance recital DVD was in the camcorder, as well as my son's Kindergarten graduation DVD, and many other moments in our lives that cannot be replaced. Not to mention we took a cruise with no cameras. I asked their representative to fax or email a copy of the key entry report he obtained and that we were discussing, but he said he would not provide a copy to me, and that I would have to obtain it though the Police Dept. or my attorney, which is what I am in the process of doing at the moment. The last time their representative and I spoke regarding the incident (Friday), he became beligerant, accusing my husband and I of having "changed" our stories, lying, and basically fabricating the entire story. After speaking with him for the last time, I felt like I was on trial for my cameras being stolen!! Needless to say, I doubt the Days Hotel will replace my cameras without getting our attorney involved. Their representative seemed quite used to the procedure of dealing with customers who have had belongings stolen with his canned responses and defenses for the hotel, which coincides nicely with the statement from the police department. He even mentioned more than once that "everyone else" who has something stolen, or "all the other people," etc. I am certain I am not the only one. With this said, I am contimplating contacting Primetime or 20/20 Investigates or Dateline to expose this apparent ring of camera theft at this hotel! If you choose this hotel, HANG ON TO YOUR BELONGINGS!!!! I am a firm believer in what goes around certainly does come back around. I hope whoever has my cameras feels really good about the money they make on my cameras after throwing my DVD's of my children in the garbage. My husband and myself are both employees of a major U.S. airline and have been for nearly 50 years collectively. This is the first time in our lifetimes of traveling the world that we have experienced such as this. We do however plan to share our experience with the Days Hotel with as many fellow employees, travelers, family members, friends and San Diego-based military personnel as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but they charged tax that wasn't on web site”
Reviews.Author: wsame
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 22 for 2 nights and found the hotel condition to be about average 3 star mainly because it was old but functional. We booked through its hotel web site which showed total amount including taxes but this is incorrect. They added additional $1.84/night "San Diego Marketing Tourism Assessment". I will complain to BBB about this improper business practice. They don't tell you taxes til you checkout. Pluses that you normally don't find include refrigerator, microwave, and wi-fi internet from your room. Parking was crowded and small spaces.

Reviews.Title: “The pictures were not at all what we got”
Reviews.Author: javaArizona
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel from June 8th through June 10th. The room smelled very bad when we first walked in. I actually sprayed my husband's cologne all over the room to try and mask the smell. The pictures on their website are NOT at all what we got. The floor was filthy. After my children showered, their feet got dirty just from walking on the carpet, so dirty in fact, we had to wash their feet before they got into bed. It was so bad, we actually wanted to leave a day early. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The only thing I can say is don't believe the pictures as they are very deceiving. The only positive thing I can say is that the staff was pretty friendly and we received a pretty good discount on SeaWorld tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: pwp_ph
Reviews.Content: No complimentary breakfast but the complimentary shuttle took us to all the places we wanted to visit. Front desk offers discounted theme park tickets. Too bad we didn't buy our Disneyland tickets from there. We assumed Anaheim hotels would offer the same discounted park tickets. Although, the place looks kinda creepy since it was near the main road, there were no untoward incidents during our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: STFC69
Reviews.Content: Faced with the prospect of choosing a hotel from the many on offer in San Diego we eventually chose Days Inn. We stopped there for four nights at the start of our holiday and we can certainly recommend it as excellent value. We chose the slightly more expensive rooms. The facilities were good and the hotel staff excellent. The hotel bus saved us from having to negotiate the road systems and the drivers were really helpful. Well done to all the staff involved for giving us such a great start to our holiday in California.

Reviews.Title: “We weren't disappointed with our first stay”
Reviews.Author: MOJO329
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the hotels located on Hotel Circle, we decided upon staying at the Days Inn despite some negative reviews that travellers gave this hotel. Our room was located on the second floor which may be considered the older section of this hotel property. We spent very little time in our room as we were gone for the day and returned to our room later in the evening. Our room was an older room but clean. Upon entering the room there was a sanitizing odour. Seeing that our room had an exterior entry, we kept our curtains shut and windows closed. It would have been preferred if we could have opened our windows at night and had sunlight come into our room in the morning. When reserving a room at this hotel, we were looking for a hotel with a modest room rate, close to San Diego attractions, no charge for parking for hotel guests, easy access to and above all was clean. This hotel/room met our requirements perfectly. There is a restaurant that is attached to the hotel. Prices are reasonable as we only ate there once for breakfast. There is a Denny's located nearby. It would have been great if this hotel offered a complimentary breakfast as others do in the area. Front desk staff was knowledgeable and presented us with a map of the nearby groceries, restaurants, shopping, sports arena, etc. that were a definite asset during our stay. We will definitely consider staying at this location if we are ever in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay.”
Reviews.Author: familytravel13
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel and a decent price. No big frills, but clean and adequate. It is located along Hotel Circle--the street off the highway that is packed with hotels. We felt safe and were close to all attractions. Hotel offered free shuttle service but we chose to use our rental car. Parking can be limited. You may not be parked right in front of your room. Outside corridors mean you can hear noisy feet outside, but I didn't hear any noise from the highways. We knew we would only be sleeping there, so this was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “good base for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBruce
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week and had no complaints. The staff were helpful every time I needed assistance. The room was clean and quiet even though we faced the road. Free internet access in the foyer was a bonus. Didn't find that anywhere else in our three weeks in the US. Really appreciated the complementary lift to the zoo. Especially pleased they drove me to Balboa Park (great place to spend a day at museums and galleries) on my own when car hire arrangements fell through. Highly recommend their restaurant. Friendly service and good food. Breakfast and dinner. Don't go to the family restaurant attached to a motel just west of them. worst food I ever had served up to me. Walking distance (1 mile) to shopping mall/cinemas and transit system. Also a short walk to a motel with Avis car hire outlet. (just the other side of hwy)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Neighbors, Moldy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SleeplessMom12
Reviews.Content: Our first night was in one of their buildings with outdoor corridors. These rooms have large gaps under the doors and are right off the parking lot. All the noise of honking horns, noisy neighbors coming home from the bars at 2:30 am, people yelling from building to building come right into the rooms through thin walls and under those door gaps! Management was willing to move us to their "much nicer rooms" in their back building for our last two nights, but we never did receive an apology or a check-in on how our other nights went. Back building has interior corridors and we were promised a quieter stay (another guest told us that construction workers frequent this hotel and do have a tendancy to party all night, so this wasn't just a one night occurance). Room in back building was a bit nicer, but windows were still extremely moldy. Neither room had good ventillation and rooms were damp for hours after showering. Second night was better, but last night was horrible again. Next door neighbors were up all night, shouting. Desk clerk did come up at 1:30 am to check on noise, but it continued through night, at least until we checked out at 6:00 am. Much nicer hotels are available on Hotel Circle! We would have moved if we hadn't been locked into Days Hotel by booking through travel company. Elevator permits were expired!! Good features included: nice size pool, nice hot tub - both comfortable even in cold winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: tadjr
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place to stay for a quick overnight in San Diego. We werent looking for anything special since we were only going to be in the room to just sleep and shower. I read the reviews and decided that this hotel sounded perfect. It was. Close to the attractions and inexpensive. When we checked in, we got a call about 10 mins later from the office wanting to know if everything was ok. It was. We noticed that we needed more towels and called down to the front to get some sent to the room. They came quickly. Again, about 10 mins later another call to make sure we got the towels. We chose a room on the third floor about halfway back so it was fairly quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good place to stay inexpensive. It was clean and quiet and close.

Reviews.Title: “okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: chatwizme
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply just "okay" for the price. We booked on getawaytoday, for a San Diego family trip, and we knew it would be no frills. There were nine of us total, and we had two rooms. One room had a terrible musty smell that we tried to mask with Lysol spray. That helped for a few minutes at a time. The other room had ants crawling all over the bathroom sink area. Basically, the rooms were clean, the bedding was clean and crisp, and the beds were fairly comfortable. There is a small convience store within walking distance that helped out with treats and drinks. There is also a restaurant on the property called Pan Pan. We ate an excellent breakfast there. We were in a hurry and the waitress was right there to help us get out the door on time. We used the hotel shuttle service to take us to SeaWorld, and pick us up, and that is definitely the way to go. The girl at the front desk was VERY professional and helpful and had great customer service skills. In fact, her great personality would be about the only reason I'd book again at this hotel. It was just a little bit too much on the borderline of being awful.

Reviews.Title: “Free internet in hotel lobby!”
Reviews.Author: bargain
Reviews.Content: After staying for a week in Anaheim at a hotel that charged for internet usage, we were thrilled to find that the Days Inn Hotel Circle provided free internet and printing in their lobby. The restaurant on site - Pam Pam - provided us with very good service and the food was so good that we ate there every day (we stayed from Dec 3 - Dec 7, 2007)! We requested for a room upgrade (the room in the older part of the hotel smelt moldy) and were happy with our room in the newer building. The shuttle bus driver, Gerald or Jared (not sure which is correct...pardon my hearing), was friendly and gave the passengers helpful hints about places we were visiting. Overall, we had a pleasant stay. Front desk staff could be friendlier though.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed immesurably”
Reviews.Author: snumps
Reviews.Content: During Christmas holidays in 2006, my husband and I stayed with our 3 year old son in this hotel. While the rooms were a little older looking, they were very clean. What impressed us, though, was the service. The people there went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The men running the shuttle buses, in particular, were very helpful and friendly. They would drive us, if they weren't busy, to other destinations (like the local mall), and would do extra runs for us to the main attractions (the zoo and Seaworld), again if they weren't busy. We have again this year decided to stay at the hotel. This year we are travelling with our 4 year old son and 10 month old daughter. I had questions about accomodating my daughter - she needs a crib - as well as some other questions. I e-mailed the hotel, and within 24 hours got a response back addressing my concerns. While I have not stayed there yet this season, I am confident that our stay will be just as enjoyable as the last one. While the rooms might be a little dated(but clean), the service is impeccable. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ladybug707
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very nice about putting us in a parking level room so we wouldn't have to go up and down with 3 kids. The room was clean and had very little hotel funk to it. The beds were comfortable but the pillows were not. The water stunk, but I guess thats just city water. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Days Inn Hotel Circle for 6 nights before going on a cruise and 1 night after. Both times we booked a business class room, and both of our stays at this hotel were amazing. The property is newly renovated and is a great value. We got a discounted rate with our CAA membership, which was well spent! The rooms are clean, freshly remodeled, have new bedding, a large bathroom area (with the sink and counter area outside of where the toilet and shower are), have comfortable matresses and great, new bedding. There is free internet access in the hotel lobby, as well as staff to help you book tours and to provide information on attractions. Our room was cleaned and refreshed daily by mid-morning. We were able to check-in early during both arrivals without any difficulty. Everything about this hotel was fantastic and we would recommend it to travelers spending any amount of time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest man in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: ernsmum
Reviews.Content: The guy who is the bellman/shuttle driver during the day has to be the worst possible advert for this hotel! We were on the so-called shuttle (totally agree with the comments in the previous post about availability) when he shouted out 'Do you have your ID with you?'. We asked him why we needed it (we were only going Downtown!) and all he did was yell at us to answer his question. We only discovered later in the journey that the ID query was to do with the fact we were dropping people off at a Navy base. That was the first and last time we had anything to do with the shuttle as it runs for the hotel's convenience, not the guests. Add to that the fact that the bellmen who organises the pick-ups is also the driver and you'll see that he's not actually around at the hotel very often. Our idea of a shuttle is that it takes guests where and when they desire (within reason, of course). Definitley mislead by the hotel's website on that one. Having said that, the rest of our week's stay was fine. Terri, our waitress in Pam Pam, was excellent and by far the best person we met at the hotel. Shuttle-man could learn a lot from her!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!! More than just clean. Definitely would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Robyn808
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not what I expected.... It was BETTER! First, I have to tell you that I am very picky!!! I don't stay at yucky hotels/motels. I took a chance on this hotel even with a 1 star rating because of all the great reviews on tripadvisor.com. The room at the Days Inn were comparable to the one i saw at the Crowne Plaza. The Days offered 2 queens or 1 King at a rate of $86.00 per night when all the other hotels were offering nothing less than $130-$155.00 per night . The Room is big and the decor was better than I expected. The bathroom was very clean. The amenities I was looking for were FREE parking, FREE High Speed Internet access, and FREE shuttles to the airport and most shopping malls and attractions. Other great amenitites were the hairdryer, iron/board, large refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in rooms. Since I decided not to rent a car, the shuttles were a significant convenience. The Days Inn is a diamond in the rough!!! I would definitely recommend this property and would stay here again without reservation even if I could spend more for a luxury hotel. Last but not least.... I felt safe staying there alone, which gave me very restful nights during my busy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Nothing Bad About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZOZ-team
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. Ample parking and friendly staff with no issues on check in or check out. Large comfortable rooms and bathrooms, serviced daily and nice and clean. Only stayed for two nights but would definatley reccommend a stay here if staying in San Diego. Bus right outside the entrance which can take you into the city or to Fashion Valley Mall or the Westfield shopping centre. Pam Pam's was the highlight, food was great and the service in this cafe is better than we had experienced on the whole trip, also good takeaway coffee). Definately include a trip to Tijuana if you are staying in San Diego, was a highlight. Pool and spa also available but was too cold at the time we stayed. All in all was a great place to stay and would highly recommend, no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ninanene
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter and everything it was great! The room was clean and everything we needed. We had some pounding up above one afternoon but we called the front desk and they offered us a differant room or to go and speak to the guests in the room above. I asked them to talk to the guests so I wouldn't have to pack up and move again and we never heard another sound. Don't waste your time on the Pam Pam grill, service was lousy and food was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: seniorfuntraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nites. We were very comfortable in our quiet room on the 3rd floor ,which was very spacious with a small kitchenette. We enjoyed the heated pool and jaccuzzi. We were able to walk to a 24 hour family restaurant and convenience store closeby. To our surprize when we asked what bus to take to the attractions they said '"we will sign you up which time do you want to go"? and "we will pick you up." They even one nite drive us down to "Old Town" so we could tour area and have dinner. If you are traveling without a car, this is the place to stay. You are close to public transportation but staff will van you to your point of interest. If you plan to go to San Diego to go to Sea World, Zoo, Old Town, or other attractions this is your hotel. Also they are family friendly, offer AAA discount and other discounts. We stayed for less than $70. a nite. This is a must stay!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cenny
Reviews.Content: Our stay was okay ,,, The Room was smaller then previous hotel and as we had arranged a rollaway for our son we had to cancel it as there was no way it would fit without us having no spare room .... Our Son and daughter then slept in the Queen Bed and it wasn't too bad !!!! The view from room was nothing to look at , as was a dried up hill... The noise from above when trying to sleep was abit annoying to start with as sounded like a wee heard of elephants but we cranked up the air condition to cover it ... The Air conditioner wasn't working properly to start with but the front desk quickly had that sorted for us ... The hotel is old BUT like any hotel I like to stay in as long as it is clean I am happy with this .. Pool area was ok but lost the sun early because of high trees surrounding this.. Free Shuttle was excellent ,, also the Seven Seas restaurant was prefered over the Pam Pam ...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Small Hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: fresgal
Reviews.Content: Once again, I took my 75-year-old aunt with me on another short vacation, this time to San Diego. I specifically wanted a hotel with free shuttle service because I did not want to rent a car. After reading many positive reviews about Days Inn's shuttle service, I definitely wanted to stay there, but I wanted to avoid getting a room in the older section of the hotel with exterior corridors because of the negative reviews about the quality of those rooms. There were very positive reviews, though, about the newer rooms in the Sunset wing at the rear of the hotel called Business Place rooms. I originally booked two exterior corridor rooms on Trip Rewards for just $76.50, but then I called the hotel directly and spoke with Tanya, the reservations manager. I told her that I was concerned about the quality of those rooms, and she told me that when we arrived if there were any Business Place rooms available that she would upgrade us at no extra charge. Those rooms usually are at a rate of about $145 per night, so getting them for just $76.50 really saved me a ton of money. I later learned that Tanya went ahead and upgraded us to Business Place rooms even before we got there. The Business Place rooms are terrific! The furnishings and decor are very nice. The beds are clean, comfortable, and neatly made. There is a refrigerator and microwave in the rooms. A very nice added touch is that each day, the hotel supplies its Business Place guests with a Snack Pack which consists of two bottles of water, two granola bars, and two packs of microwave popcorn.
